Article Title: The $7.5 billion deal that Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella 'sealed' in 20 minutes
Article Text:
Microsoft's $7.5 billion GitHub deal

Earlier this year, Satya Nadella completed 10 years as Microsoft CEO. Nadella took over as Microsoft CEO in February 2014. Soon after taking over the helm, Nadella is said to have rapidly overhauled the almost 40-year-old company. Nadella is reported to have "pushed Microsoft to embrace cloud computing and open-source software that customers could freely adapt to." Nadella introduced a wave of open-source technologies, supercharging Microsoft’s cloud business.Over the years, under Nadella's leadership Microsoft has doubled its market share in cloud computing, cementing its role as the No. 2 behind Amazon , a position it continues to hold -- followed by search giant Google.A recent report in New York Times, talks about various deals that the company has made under CEO Nadella including the $7.5 billion acquisition of developers platform GitHub . Nadella reportedly 'sealed' the deal in 20 minutes."In 2018, he needed only 20 minutes to greenlight the acquisition of the world’s most important open-source company: GitHub, the site where developers shared and collaborated on software code," said the report.After executives spent years debating whether to buy GitHub, Nat Friedman, a former Microsoft executive who worked for Nadella for five years, told New York Times that he pitched the idea to Nadella and other senior leaders at an annual executive retreat at the Suncadia Resort in the Cascade Mountains.“Do we have the right to do this?” Nadella reportedly asked. "In other words: Would people still use GitHub if it was run by Microsoft?" The executives are said to have debated the question for 20 minutes, Friedman said. "Then Nadella slapped his hand on the table and said, “We should do it.” Report adds that within weeks, Nadella agreed to buy GitHub for $7.5 billion in June 2018.“We will accelerate enterprise developers’ use of GitHub, with our direct sales and partner channels and access to Microsoft’s global cloud infrastructure and services,” Nadella had said on the acquisition.
Article Summary: Satya Nadella took over as Microsoft CEO in February 2014. He is said to have rapidly overhauled the almost 40-year-old company. Under his leadership, Microsoft has doubled its market share in cloud computing, cementing its role as the No. 2 behind Amazon.

Article Title: Apple releases short film "Suerte" shot entirely on iPhone 15 Pro Max
Article Text:
Story of the short film

Apple is showcasing the impressive camera capabilities of its latest flagship smartphone, the iPhone 15 Pro Max , with the release of a new short film titled " Suerte " (Spanish for "Good Luck"). This short film follows the story of a young musician on a personal pilgrimage, highlighting the diverse filming possibilities offered by the phone's advanced camera system."Suerte" takes viewers on a heartfelt journey with Iván Cornejo, a rising singer-songwriter.Seeking inspiration for his next hit, Cornejo travels to his Mexican roots, embarking on a series of adventures captured entirely on the iPhone 15 Pro Max. The short film, directed by duo Cliqua, showcases the phone's ability to produce professional-grade cinematography.Apple strategically showcases various camera features of the iPhone 15 Pro Max throughout the film. From capturing vibrant landscapes and lively street scenes to intimate close-ups and dynamic action sequences, the short film aims to impress viewers with the phone's versatility.Apple's release of "Suerte" reinforces the growing trend of using smartphones for professional filmmaking. With advancements in camera technology, smartphones are becoming increasingly powerful tools for creators, allowing them to capture high-quality visuals without the need for bulky and expensive equipment.
Article Summary: Apple releases a new short film titled " Suerte " (Spanish for "Good Luck") The short film follows the story of a young musician on a personal pilgrimage. Apple strategically showcases various camera features of the iPhone 15 Pro Max. The film reinforces the growing trend of using smartphones for professional filmmaking.

Article Title: 10 terms Microsoft wants everyone should know in AI era
Article Text:
Artificial intelligence

Machine Learning

Large Language Model

Generative AI

Hallucinations

Responsible AI

Multimodal models

Prompts

Copilots

Plugins

While the concept of Artificial Intelligence (AI) has been around for decades, recent breakthroughs in machine learning have significantly boosted its development and public awareness. The term gained wider recognition in 2022 when OpenAI launched ChatGPT chatbot. This, coupled with major companies like Microsoft , Google and Facebook-parent Meta entering the field with impactful AI products, propelled AI into the mainstream.Today, a multitude of AI companies are driving the next wave of innovation, with new terminology emerging to define this exciting landscape. Here are 10 key AI terms you should be familiar with.Artificial intelligence (AI) is a super-smart computer system that can imitate human tasks like understanding language, making decisions, translating languages, analysing sentiment, and learning from experience. AI processes vast amounts of data through algorithms to create models that automate tasks requiring human intelligence.Machine learning (ML) is a subset of AI and the method to achieve it. In ML, computer systems learn to identify patterns and make predictions by running data through algorithms repeatedly with varying inputs and feedback, much like practising piano scales millions of times to sight-read music. ML is ideal for solving complex problems like image recognition and language translation.Large language models (LLMs) use machine learning to mimic human communication and are the underlying technology of all chatbots. Based on neural networks (NNs), which are inspired by the human brain, they are trained on massive amounts of text to learn language patterns and relationships.Generative AI leverages the power of LLMs to make new things, not just rewrite or provide information about existing things. It learns patterns and structures and then generates something that’s similar but new. It can make things like pictures, music, text, videos and code.Generative AI can create stories, poems, and songs but can also produce inaccurate responses, which it presents as if they are factually true. This is called "hallucinations" or "fabrications," because it can't distinguish between real and fake information.Responsible AI is a term used to denote that systems are safe and fair at every level, including the machine learning model, software, user interface, and application access rules. It's crucial for systems that make important decisions in areas like education and healthcare, as they can reflect human biases from their training data.A multimodal model can simultaneously work with different data types, such as images, sounds, and text. It combines this information to perform tasks like answering questions about images, making it the ultimate multitask.A prompt is an instruction in language, images, or code that tells the AI what task to perform. Engineers and users should carefully design prompts to achieve the desired outcome from large language models.Copilots is a terminology used by Microsoft to denote its AI models in its products that help users expedite the working. It is essentially a digital assistant that helps with tasks like writing, coding, summarising and searching across various applications.Plugins for AI function similarly to apps on a smartphone, enabling AI applications to fulfil specific needs without altering the core model. They facilitate interaction with other software, access to new information, performing complex calculations, and interfacing with other programs, thereby enhancing the AI's capabilities by integrating it more deeply into the digital ecosystem.
Article Summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is a super-smart computer system. It can imitate human tasks like understanding language, making decisions, translating languages, analysing sentiment, and learning from experience. The term gained wider recognition in 2022 when OpenAI launched ChatGPT chatbot.

Article Title: Github CEO: “If I were to join a software company in Bengaluru, the first thing I would….”
Article Text: Thomas Dohmke, CEO of GitHub , shared his insights on how he would approach joining a software company in Bengaluru, India's tech hub. During a recent visit to the country, Dohmke highlighted the importance of understanding a company's unique workflow and codebase in an interaction with the Times of India."If I were to join a software company in Bengaluru, the first thing I would have to figure out is how they operate," Dohmke told TOI.He emphasised that even with years of software engineering experience, adapting to a new company's processes is crucial.The GitHub chief explained that the next step would be to dive deep into the company's existing code. "Then I have to figure out how things work, what's in which file, what did the engineer think when they built a particular thing, and how I can now extend it," he said.Dohmke's comments came as part of a broader discussion on the evolving landscape of software development , particularly in light of advancing AI technologies . He stressed that understanding a company's specific context remains a critical skill, even as AI tools become more prevalent in coding.To address these challenges, GitHub has developed AI-powered tools like Co-pilot Workspace . This new product features three AI agents designed to assist developers in refining project ideas, determining necessary files, and implementing tasks.While acknowledging the power of AI in coding, Dohmke maintained that human skills in understanding and navigating complex software environments remain invaluable. His insights offer a roadmap for both seasoned professionals and newcomers looking to make their mark in Bengaluru's competitive tech industry.
Article Summary: Thomas Dohmke, CEO of GitHub, shared his insights on how he would approach joining a software company in Bengaluru, India's tech hub. He stressed that understanding a company's specific context remains a critical skill, even as AI tools become more prevalent in coding.

Article Title: Global Cyber Threat Report: RansomHub Leads, FakeUpdates targets Indian organisations
Article Text: RansomHub has emerged as the most prevalent ransomware group in June 2024, overtaking the long-standing leader LockBit3 , according to the latest Global Threat Index released by Check Point Software .The report reveals that RansomHub, a relative newcomer believed to be a reincarnation of the Knight ransomware, was responsible for 21% of published ransomware attacks last month.This surge comes in the wake of law enforcement action against LockBit3 in February, which caused the group to lose loyalty among its affiliates.Meanwhile, FakeUpdates (also known as SocGholish) has become the most widespread malware globally, impacting 7% of organisations worldwide. In India, the malware has seen a particular surge, with Indian organisations facing an average of 2,924 attacks per week over the past six months – more than double the global average of 1,401 attacks.The Education/Research sector remained the most targeted industry globally, followed by Government/Military and Healthcare. In India, these sectors also topped the list of most impacted industries.Check Point researchers have identified a new Windows backdoor called BadSpace, delivered through the FakeUpdates campaign. The malware spreads through compromised websites and fake browser updates, employing sophisticated obfuscation and anti-sandbox techniques to avoid detection."It appears that actions against LockBit3 have had the desired impact. However, as previously suggested, its decline only makes way for other groups to take control and continue their ransomware campaigns against organisations globally," said Maya Horowitz, VP of Research at Check Point Software.Other notable findings from the report include:- Androxgh0st and AgentTesla rounded out the top three most prevalent malware families globally.- The most exploited vulnerability was an information disclosure flaw in Check Point VPN (CVE-2024-24919).- In the mobile malware category, Joker took the top spot, followed by Anubis and AhMyth.As cyber threats continue to evolve, organisations are urged to remain vigilant and keep their security measures up to date to protect against these emerging threats.
Article Summary: RansomHub was responsible for 21% of published ransomware attacks last month. FakeUpdates (also known as SocGholish) has become the most widespread malware globally. In India, the malware has seen a particular surge, with Indian organisations facing an average of 2,924 attacks per week over the past six months.

Article Title: Google is discontinuing this browser for its ChromeOS devices
Article Text: Google announced it is ending support for LaCros , an experimental standalone browser for Chromebooks, as the company shifts focus to integrating more of the Android stack into ChromeOS . The decision marks the conclusion of a four-year project aimed at improving update speeds and performance for Chromebook users.LaCros, short for Linux and ChromeOS, was designed to separate the Chrome browser from the underlying operating system, potentially allowing for faster updates and extended support for older devices.Google began development in 2020 and made it available for testing in August 2023.Despite its promise, Google has decided to discontinue LaCros support with ChromeOS version 128. The company stated that embracing portions of the Android stack would be a more effective way to accelerate innovation on Chromebooks."We believe this will be a more effective way to help accelerate the pace of innovation on Chromebook," Google explained in a post on the ChromeOS Beta Tester Community Forum.The tech giant assures users that this change will not impact their Chromebook experience. Monthly releases and security fixes for both Chrome and ChromeOS will continue as usual.Google credits the LaCros experiment with providing valuable feedback, leading to performance improvements in ChromeOS, including faster login times and enhanced battery life during video playback.This decision comes amid significant changes to ChromeOS in recent years, including a shift to a four-week update schedule and extended support for new Chromebooks up to 10 years. Additionally, Google's recent announcement about building ChromeOS on the Android Linux Kernel aims to further align development between the two platforms.While some users who relied on LaCros for features like account switching may be affected, the majority of Chromebook users are unlikely to notice any changes in their day-to-day usage.
Article Summary: Google is ending support for LaCros, an experimental standalone browser for Chromebooks. The decision marks the conclusion of a four-year project aimed at improving update speeds and performance for Chromebook users. The tech giant assures users that this change will not impact their Chromebook experience.

Article Title: Chandigarh woman loses Rs 80 lakh to SIM card scam: Here’s what happened
Article Text:
How the scam unfolded?

How to check SIM cards registered on your Aadhaar Card?

Visit the TAFCOP website: https://tafcop.sancharsaathi.gov.in/telecomUser/

Enter your Mobile number in the given box

Next, enter the captcha and click on “request OTP.”

Enter the OTP you have received on your number and click on “Login.”

You will see a list of mobile numbers registered on your ID.

Check and ensure that all the active mobile numbers belong to you or to your relatives

In case of any doubt, this website gives 03 options; “Not my number”, “Not required” and “Required”.

You can report a number that is registered with your ID and does not belong to any of your family members by clicking “Not my number”.

A Chandigarh resident lost Rs 80 lakh after she received a call from fraudsters posing as a police officer. The caller told her that a SIM card in her name was allegedly being used in illegal activities. The victim, fearing arrest, agreed to the caller’s demand and transferred the money, reports Tribune India.A case has been registered with the cybercrime police station.The victim is a resident of sector 11, Chandigarh. She told police that she received a call from a person who pretended to be a police officer with the Crime Branch in Mumbai. The caller told her that a SIM card issued against her Aadhaar card was used in illegal money laundering activities.The fraudster asserted that they have received 24 money laundering complaints against her, further threatening her with an arrest. Fearing arrest, the victim followed the caller’s direction who demanded Rs 80 lakh which was to be returned if the woman was found innocent.The woman eventually transferred Rs 80 lakh to ‘clear the case’, only to realize later that she had been scammed.The Department of Telecommunication (DoT) launched a web portal called Telecom Analytics for Fraud Management & Consumer Protection or TAFCOP to check SIM cards issued under one ID. Here’s how to do it
Article Summary: A Chandigarh resident lost Rs 80 lakh after she received a call from fraudsters posing as a police officer. The caller told her that a SIM card in her name was allegedly being used in illegal activities. The victim, fearing arrest, agreed to the caller’s demand and transferred the money.

Article Title: Asus launches India's first CoPilot+ PC, the Vivobook S 15 OLED, with Qualcomm’s Snapdragon X Elite processor and AI features
Article Text:
Asus Vivobook S 15 OLED with Qualcomm Snapdragon X Elite: Price, availability in India

Asus Vivobook S 15 OLED with Qualcomm Snapdragon X Elite: Specifications, features, and more

Asus has launched India's first CoPilot+ PC, the Vivobook S 15 OLED, featuring Qualcomm’s Snapdragon X Elite Processor. Here’s all you need to know about the Vivobook S 15 OLED.Priced at INR 1,24,990, the Vivobook S 15 OLED is now available on Flipkart, Asus e-shop, and other retail channels.The Vivobook S 15 OLED boasts a 15.6-inch 3K 120Hz Asus Lumina OLED display, offering vibrant visuals with a 100% DCI-P3 colour gamut and VESA DisplayHDR True Black 600 certification.The laptop measures at 1.47cm in thickness and weighs 1.42kg.At the heart of the new laptop is the Qualcomm Snapdragon X Elite Processor with Adreno integrated graphics, complemented by 16GB LPDDR5X RAM and a 1TB PCIe 4.0 SSD. The Snapdragon X Elite processor features Qualcomm’s Hexagon NPU, promising 45 TOPS of neural processing prowess. The laptop offers up to 18 hours of battery life with 90W USB Type-C fast charging.The Vivobook S 15 OLED comes equipped with a range of connectivity options, including USB4 ports supporting 4K display output and 40 GB/s data transfer.The laptop also features military-grade MIL-STD 810H durability. The VivoBook S15 also incorporates Asus IceCool thermal technology for efficient heat dissipation and Asus Antimicrobial Guard for added hygiene protection. It comes with Windows Hello face recognition supported by a 1080p Full HD 3DNR webcam.
Article Summary: The Vivobook S 15 OLED boasts a 15.6-inch 3K 120Hz Asus Lumina OLED display. The laptop measures at 1.47cm in thickness and weighs 1.42kg. Qualcomm’s Hexagon NPU promises 45 TOPS of neural processing prowess.

Article Title: Apple releases iOS 18 Developer Beta 3 with Dynamic Wallpaper and other improvements
Article Text: Apple released the third developer beta of iOS 18 to developers on Monday, improving upon the new features that are set to roll out for everybody with stable release later this year.One of the most notable additions in iOS 18 beta 3 is a new dynamic wallpaper that shifts colours based on the time of day. Dark Mode received significant attention in this update, with Apple extending its reach to third-party app icons.For apps with simpler colour schemes, Apple automatically adjusts the icons, while more complex designs receive a darker tint.The Photos app saw a minor but welcome change with the addition of a dedicated "Select" button on the main interface, streamlining the process of choosing multiple images. This update also reorganised the emoji, Memoji, and stickers interface in Messages, combining them into a single, more accessible menu.Other improvements include a refined Flashlight interface with more intuitive controls for adjusting brightness and spread, and an updated RCS toggle in Messages settings that provides additional context about the feature's functionality.The iOS 18 beta is currently available only to registered developers, with a public beta expected to launch later this month. Apple plans to release the final version of iOS 18 to all users this fall, likely in September alongside new iPhone models.As with all beta software, users should expect some performance and stability issues. Apple continues to refine the operating system based on tester feedback, addressing bugs and improving overall functionality with each release.
Article Summary: The iOS 18 beta is currently available only to registered developers, with a public beta expected to launch later this month. Apple plans to release the final version of iOS 18 to all users this fall, likely in September alongside new iPhone models. As with all beta software, users should expect some performance and stability issues.

Article Title: Apple iPhone users, government has a warning on these SMSes
Article Text:
Here’s what the post reads

New Transnational #Scam Alert:

#iPhone users are receiving scam messages via

iMessage

regarding package from random accounts. Clicking on suspicious links may be avoided and read receipts may be disabled for such suspicious messages.

What does the scam message read?

India Post:

Your package has arrived at the warehouse and we attempted delivery twice but were unable to due to incomplete address information. Please update your address details within 48 hours, otherwise your package will be returned. Please update the address in the link: https://indiapostsz.top/IN

After the update is completed we will re-deliver within 24 hours, India Post!

How to spot a fake scam message?

Apple iPhone users, have you received a message allegedly about an undelivered parcel at India post warehouse? If yes, then be warned. This is a new scam where fraudsters are sending fake messages to iPhone users about packages from random accounts.Cyber Dost – the cybersafety and cybersecurity awareness handle maintained by the Ministry of Home Affairs, Government of India has warned Apple users against these new ‘ transnational scam ’ messages.It has shared a post on X (formerly Twitter) informing users and advising them not to click on suspicious links in these messages.With some patience and intelligence, it is possible to spot scam messages. In case you receive such a message, look for signs like urgency in taking an action, poor grammar in sentence formation, suspicious links and unusual sender’s address among others.
Article Summary: Fraudsters are sending fake messages to iPhone users about packages from random accounts. Government of India has warned Apple users against these new ‘ transnational scam ’ messages. Look for signs like urgency in taking an action, poor grammar in sentence formation, suspicious links and unusual sender’s address among others.

Article Title: Cognizant settles lawsuits against CFO and other execs filed by Wipro, pays $505,000 for settlement; read HR head's statement
Article Text: Cognizant CFO Jatin Dalal settled Wipro’s non-compete lawsuit for $505,087. Former Wipro SVP Mohammad Haque settled his lawsuit. Dalal’s arbitration occurred in Bengaluru City Civil Court. Wipro claimed Haque sent confidential files via Gmail before joining Cognizant as Senior VP. Wipro clarified actions weren’t personal. Dalal and Wipro's Saurabh Govil were satisfied with the confidential settlement.
Article Summary: Cognizant CFO Jatin Dalal settled Wipro’s non-compete lawsuit for $505,087. Former Wipra SVP Mohammad Haque settled his lawsuit. Dalal's arbitration occurred in Bengaluru City Civil Court.

Mukesh Ambani-owned Reliance Jio has announced a price increase for all its prepaid and postpaid plans, effective from today, July 3. The new tariff prices will be implemented across all touchpoints and channels. The most affordable plan, now priced at Rs 189, was previously Rs 155, marking a 22% rise. It's important to note that despite the price hike, the plan benefits such as call minutes and data allowance will remain unchanged.The telecom service provider has announced the price hike for 14 prepaid unlimited plans, 3 data add-on plans and 2 postpaid plans.Here’s a list of all the plans:The new tariff plans feature various price adjustments for popular monthly, bi-monthly, quarterly, annual, data add-on, and postpaid options. Monthly plans now range from Rs 189 to Rs 449 (increased from Rs 155 to Rs 399). Bi-monthly plans are priced between Rs 579 and Rs 629 for data ranging from 1.5GB/day to 2GB/day over 56 days. Quarterly plans are available from Rs 479 to Rs 1199, offering 6GB to 3GB/day over 84 days. Annual plans range from Rs 1899 to Rs 3599.Note that once the price hike goes into effect, the unlimited 5G data will only be available with plans offering 2GB/day data or above.
Article Summary: Reliance Jio announces price hike for 14 prepaid unlimited plans, 3 data add-on plans and 2 postpaid plans. Monthly plans now range from Rs 189 to Rs 449, with data offerings. Quarterly and annual plans also see adjustments. Telecom service provider ensures unchanged benefits amidst the price hike.

Article Title: Reliance Jio launches new gadget: Price, features and other details
Article Text:
JioTag Air features



JioTag Air price and availability

Reliance Jio has launched a new tracking device called the JioTag Air. Successor to last year’s JioTag, it comes with a host of new features. Unlike JioTag that worked only with the JioThings app, the JioTag Air is compatible with Apple Find My feature as well. Here are the details about Jio's new tracking deviceJioTag Air is a sleek asset tracker that allows you to find and track your valuables like keys, ID cards, wallets, purses, luggages, pets and other such items prone to misplacing and losing.It works with both iOS and Android devices. It is compatible with iPhones running iOS14 and above, and Android 9 and above.It is equipped with Bluetooth version 5.3 for wireless device tracking. The device has a built-in speaker and can be used to play loud sound of 90-120 db to locate lost items. As mentioned above, it works with both Apple Find My network and the JioThings app. However, a user can choose only one app at a time.Android users can pair with JioThings app and track the tagged item on this app itself. For Apple Users, once paired with Apple Find My app, JioTag Air sends continuous Bluetooth signals that can be detected by nearby devices in the Find My network like iPhones, iPads and Macs. These devices send the location of the JioTag Air to iCloud. Apple users can share tagged items on Apple Find My app with other Apple users. In addition, they can go to Apple’s Find My app and locate the item connected with the JioAirTag on map. Enabling Lost Mode will send automatic notifications to the paired Apple device when the lost item is detected in the Apple Find My network.JioTag Air is listed on the company’s website with a price of Rs 2,999 . But it can be purchased at Rs 1,499. It will be available in Blue, Red and Grey colour variants. Some of the bank offers listed on the site include cashback on payments using Paytm, CredUPI and select credit cards.JioAir Tag will also be available for purchase via JioMart, Reliance Digital and Amazon.
Article Summary: JioTag Air is a sleek asset tracker that allows you to find and track your valuables like keys, ID cards, wallets, purses, luggages, pets and other such items prone to misplacing and losing. It works with both iOS and Android devices. It is compatible with iPhones running iOS14 and above, and Android 9 and above.

Bharti Airtel has announced a price hike across all its prepaid and postpaid plans. Airtel's revised tariff plans will be effective from today, July 3. As announced by the company, it has increased the price of its entry-level plans by 70 paise, 'in order to eliminate any burden on budget challenged consumers.'It must be noted here that while the plans have become costlier, benefits like data, call minutes, etc remain the same.In total, Airtel has increased the price of 15 prepaid and postpaid plans. These prices apply to all circles, including Bharti Hexacom Ltd. Circles. Reliance Jio and Vodafone Idea have also increased their tariff rates by up to 22%.The revised tariff increases the price of Rs 179 monthly plan to Rs 199. The plan will continue to offer 2GB mobile data per day, unlimited calling and 100 SMS per day. Validity of the plan remains 28 days. Similarly, the annual plan of Rs 1,799 offering 2GB mobile data per day, unlimited calling and 100 SMSes every day will now cost Rs 1,999.Airtel's daily data add-on plans now come at Rs 22 onwards (a hike of Rs 3 from the previous Rs 19).Coming to Airtel's postpaid plans, the price now ranges from Rs 449 to Rs 1,199. Daily data plans offering up to 3GB data per day now come with starting price of Rs 265.
Article Summary: Bharti Airtel has increased the price of its monthly plan to Rs 199, offering 2GB data daily, unlimited calling, and 100 SMS per day. The annual plan now costs Rs 1,999 with the same benefits. These changes aim to support budget- constrained consumers while maintaining service quality.

Article Title: Why Lucknow SuperGiants 'shared' this Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma photo with Elon Musk
Article Text:
What Virat Kohli told PM Modi

Lucknow SuperGiants official X, formerly Twitter, account recently replied to a post from Tesla CEO and X owner Elon Musk . In a post on X, Musk asked users to share beautiful content. Lucknow Super Giant's social media account replied to the same with a picture from the recent ICC T20 World Cup final, which was played between Indian and South Africa. The Indian team beat South Africa by 7-run to win the World Cup, which ended India's 13-year-long wait for an ICC World Cup trophy."Would be lovely to see more accounts on 𝕏 simply posting beautiful content x.com/evalovesdesign…," wrote Musk.Quoting this Elon Musk post, Lucknow SuperGiants replied, "Okay done 🥰," and along with these words shared the picture of Indian cricket team captain Rohit Sharma hugging star batsman Virat Kohli .These pictures of Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma hugging are said to have broken the internet. The pictures shared on various social media platforms including X, Instagram and Facebook have got millions of likes.Talking about the hug at the felicitation ceremony, Kohli said "We have been playing for the last 15 years, this is the first time, I see Rohit so emotional - he was crying, I was crying, a hug between both of us - I will never forget that day." The felicitation function was organised by the BCCI at the Wankhede Stadium in Mumbai.Kohli said that winning the T20 World Cup 2024 was a special moment for him as he had not realised the gravity of the moment when he was part of M.S Dhoni's team which won the 2011 ODI World Cup at this same venue. "I was 21-22 at that time and did not realise why the senior players were getting so emotional. After winning this World Cup, I have realised how special this is," said Kohli. He added that he had instantly realised that it was time for him to say goodbye to the format and make way for youngsters.During the Indian team's interaction with Prime Minister Narendra Modi at his residence on July 4, Kohli said, "We lived each ball at the end, we can't explain what was going on inside. We lost hope at one moment, then Hardik took a wicket and then with each ball, we got the energy. I am happy that I was able to contribute to the team in such a big game after a tough time. I won't be able to forget it. I was happy that I was able to take the team to a fighting total."
Article Summary: Lucknow SuperGiants official X, formerly Twitter, account recently replied to a post from Tesla CEO and X owner Elon Musk. In a post on X, Musk asked users to share beautiful content. Lucknow Super Giant's social media account replied to the same with a picture from the recent ICC T20 World Cup final, which was played between Indian and South Africa.

Article Title: Prince William's boarding school bans smartphones, mandates Nokia phone for students
Article Text:
What does the school’s new policy on smartphone ban say?

UK government’s guidance on smartphone use by kids

In a major move, a posh boarding school in the UK has decided to swap its students’ smartphones for the classic Nokia phones, reports CBS News. The policy is based on guidelines from the UK government that allows school principals to enact smartphone bans on students during the school day.Eton College , the historic and elite British boarding school is located near the royal palace in Windsor. Prince William and Harry, Ian Fleming, Tom Hiddleston and novelist George Orwell are some of its notable alumni.As per the report, parents of first-year students at Eton College were informed about the changes in a letter. It reportedly said that the incoming 13-year-old boarders must transfer their SIM cards to offline Nokia phones given by schools. The phone will only be able to make phone calls and send text messages.The report quotes a school spokesperson who said “Eton routinely reviews our mobile phone and devices policy to balance the benefits and challenges that technology brings to schools.” He further added that those joining in Year 9, essentially the equivalent of freshman year in high school for American students, “will receive a 'brick' phone for use outside the school day, as well as a school-issued iPad to support academic study.”According to Ofcom, the UK government's communications regulator, 97% of children have their own smartphone phone by the age of 12. In the new guidelines issued in February this year, the government advised all schools to “have a behaviour policy which is aligned with the school’s legal duties and standards relating to the welfare of children. It further stated that boarding schools and residential schools should prohibit the use of mobile phones throughout the teaching day, among other things.
Article Summary: The policy is based on guidelines from the UK government that allows school principals to enact smartphone bans on students during the school day. Parents of first-year students at Eton College were informed about the changes in a letter. The incoming 13-year-old boarders must transfer their SIM cards to offline Nokia phones given by schools.

Article Title: Apple shares these 8 tips to protect your iPhone, iPad and Mac from online scams
Article Text:
What is a Social engineering scam?

Fraudulent emails and other messages that look like they're from legitimate companies, including Apple.

Misleading pop-ups and ads that say your device has a security problem.

Scam phone calls or voicemails that impersonate Apple Support, Apple partners, and other well known or trusted entities or individuals.

Fake promotions that offer free products and prizes.

Unwanted Calendar invitations and subscriptions.



How to protect your Apple account and devices

Never share personal data or security information like passwords or security codes, and never agree to enter them into a webpage that someone directs you to.

Protect your Apple ID. Use two-factor authentication, always keep your contact information secure and up to date, and never share your Apple ID password or verification codes with anyone. Apple never asks for this information to provide support.

password or verification codes with anyone. Apple never asks for this information to provide support. Never use Apple Gift Cards to make payments to other people.

Learn how to identify legitimate Apple emails about your App Store or iTunes Store purchases. If you send or receive money with Apple Cash (U.S. only), treat it like any other private transaction.

Learn how to keep your Apple devices and data secure.

Download software only from sources you can trust.

Don't follow links or open or save attachments in suspicious or unsolicited messages.

Don't answer suspicious phone calls or messages claiming to be from Apple. Instead, contact Apple directly through our official support channels.

Apple has shared crucial tips on how to recognize and avoid falling victim to scams like SMS threat, phishing and more. The iPhone maker has updated its security support document that provides tips to avoid scams and learn what to do if you receive suspicious emails, phone calls, or other messages.Apple says that scams like phishing and SMS threats are called social engineering scams - a type of targeted attack that relies on impersonation, deception, and manipulation to gain access to users’ personal data.The Cupertino-based company has also listed means that the scammers can use to trick victims into sharing information or giving them money. These include:Apple has also shared a few tips that a user can do to avoid scams that target Apple accounts and devices. These include
Article Summary: Apple has shared crucial tips on how to recognize and avoid falling victim to scams like SMS threat, phishing and more. iPhone maker has updated its security support document that provides tips to avoid scams and learn what to do if you receive suspicious emails, phone calls, or other messages.

Article Title: Google Fi protects users from SIM swaps with new “Number Lock" feature
Article Text:
How to activate the feature

Google Fi wireless has introduced a security feature called ‘ Number Lock ’. This new feature empowers users to take control and prevent a growing cybersecurity threat – SIM swapping .SIM swapping occurs when a malicious actor convinces your carrier to transfer your phone number to a new SIM card in their possession. This can grant them access to your calls, texts, two-factor authentication codes, and potentially even financial accounts linked to your number.Google Fi's Number Lock acts as a digital safeguard against SIM swapping attempts.Once activated, this feature essentially locks your phone number to your existing SIM card. Any attempts to transfer your number to a new SIM, even through contacting customer service, will be denied unless you disable Number Lock. Enabling this feature provides an extra layer of security, making it significantly harder for fraudsters to hijack your phone number.Activating Number Lock is a simple process. Google Fi users can manage the feature through their online account or the Fi app. Once enabled, you'll receive a confirmation notification, giving you peace of mind that your number is locked and protected.
Article Summary: Google Fi's Number Lock acts as a digital safeguard against SIM swapping attempts. Once activated, this feature essentially locks your phone number to your existing SIM card. Any attempts to transfer your number to a new SIM, even through contacting customer service, will be denied unless you disable Number Lock.

Article Title: Here’s your chance to buy Zomato Gold membership at Rs 30 for 6 months
Article Text:
Zomato Gold benefits



Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma gives a shout-out to Zomato ad

Zomato is celebrating its 16th anniversary this year with an exciting offer on its Gold membership. The food delivery platform has announced an offer to buy Zomato Gold membership for 6 months at just Rs 30. But, there’s an important catch to it. The offer does not work for existing Gold customers. Only those who don’t have a Zomato Gold membership can avail it.Zomato Gold membership gives free delivery on all restaurants within 7km for orders above Rs 199. There is an additional discount of up to 30% above all existing offers at 20,000+ partner restaurants across India.For those unaware, Zomato was originally founded in the year 2008 by Deepinder Goyal and Pankaj Chaddah as FoodieBay. It is headquartered in Gurugram, Haryana and operates in more than 1000 cities across the country.To celebrate its 16th birthday, Zomato has shared an interesting, full page ad in the Times of India newspaper. The ad features a large photograph of its founder and CEO, Deepinder Goyal, along with other top executives. The text, written in Hindi, reads “16th janamdin par aap sabhi ko apna pyar barsane ke liye koti koti dhanyavaad” (On our 16th birthday, a big thanks to all of you for showering us with love).The ad caught the attention of many, including Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma who praised this Zomato ad. Sharing an image of the ad on X (formerly Twitter), Sharma extended his best wishes to Goyal and the entire Zomato team, hoping to see more praiseworthy marketing campaigns in the future.The post is written in Hindi which roughly translates to “On the 16th birthday of Zomato, heartiest congratulations to the chief Mr. Deepinder ji and all the members of his executive! 👏🏼👏🏼May God grant us such praiseworthy advertisements always 🤗.”
Article Summary: Zomato Gold membership gives free delivery on all restaurants within 7km for orders above Rs 199. There is an additional discount of up to 30% above all existing offers at 20,000+ partner restaurants across India. Zomato was originally founded in the year 2008 by Deepinder Goyal and Pankaj Chaddah.
